alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 7:27PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 727 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 14 miles northwest of Iron Mountain, or 30 miles southwest of Wheatland, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
